verdict.summary: StackOverflowException occurs when the execution stack overflows due to infinite recursion or excessively deep call chains. This exception cannot be caught in .NET. Common causes include recursive property setters, circular DI dependencies, and recursive serialization. Fix by identifying and breaking the recursive cycle.

dead_ends.action: Attempting to catch StackOverflowException with try-catch
dead_ends.why_fails: StackOverflowException is not catchable in .NET since .NET 2.0; the CLR terminates the process immediately when the stack overflows, so no catch block will execute

dead_ends.action: Increasing the thread stack size via Thread constructor or environment variable
dead_ends.why_fails: Only delays the crash for truly recursive code; infinite recursion will exhaust any stack size. Larger stacks also waste memory per thread and can cause OutOfMemoryException in multi-threaded scenarios

workarounds.action: Identify and break the recursive cycle in the call chain
workarounds.how: Examine the stack trace (visible in the crash dump) to find the repeating method pattern. Common causes: a property setter that assigns to itself (this.Name = Name instead of field = value), AutoMapper/serializer circular references, or recursive method missing a base case. Fix the recursion termination condition or break the cycle

workarounds.action: Convert recursive algorithms to iterative with an explicit stack
workarounds.how: Replace recursive method calls with a Stack<T> or Queue<T> data structure and a while loop. For example, replace recursive tree traversal with: var stack = new Stack<Node>(); stack.Push(root); while (stack.Count > 0) { var node = stack.Pop(); /* process and push children */ }

leads_to.condition: when large stack sizes per thread exhaust available memory
when the recursive cycle is in object serialization

preceded_by.condition: when circular reference in object graph causes infinite serialization recursion
when tracked entities with circular navigation properties trigger recursive processing

frequently_confused_with.distinction: StackOverflowException is caused by exhausting the call stack through deep recursion; OutOfMemoryException is caused by exhausting heap memory through large allocations
